results.title: Der Freischutz
results.creator_credit: Hartmut Schottler, Achim Freyer, Osterreichischer Rundfunk-Fernsehen, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen and National Video Corporation
results.brief_description: Carl Maria von Weber’s opera “Der Freischutz” with libretto by Friedrich Kind first premiered in Berlin in 1821. This production by Achim Freyer was performed in Stuttgart by the Wurttemberg State Opera Chorus and Orchestra, with Ulrich Eistert as Chorus master and musical direction by Dennis Russell Davies. Romantic, melodramatic, evil and mystical, this German folkloric tale set in the Bohemian forest tells of a rivalry between Max (Toni Kramer) and Kaspar (Wolfgang Probst) over the hand of the beautiful young Agathe (Catarina Ligendza), daughter of Kuno (Fritz Linke) the head Ranger to Prince Ottokar. For Max to be worthy of marrying Agathe, he has to win the traditional shooting contest on his wedding morning. Kaspar has already sold his soul to the devil - will Max do the same? Using colorful set designs, costumes and make-up, this stage performance has a Grimm’s fairytale quality, albeit an adult fairytale. Cast also includes Wolfgang Schone and Raili Viljakainen. Sung in German with no English subtitles. Includes booklet with English translation.

results.title: Depreciation and inflation (NP)
results.brief_description: John Cleese plays the foolhardy businessman who thinks he has had a successful year in his factory operation, unaware that inflation and depreciation of capital investment have been eating away at his profits. His crockery and cutlery business has also fallen prey to the clutches of inflation. Cleese’s more astute business friend informs him of his ignorance, providing a clear and simple explanation of the economic concepts. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: Dependence
results.brief_description: “Summary: presents graphically various sets of data and considers the relations which they reveal. discusses direct and inverse relationships and reviews the plotting of points, using cartesian and polar coordinates”

results.title: Depart de Grandes Vacances
results.brief_description: A sequel to “La Famille Marin” a language training film in which the sound track records conversations and commentary is simple French Everyday expressions and simple vocabulary are used throughout the film. The Martin family is shown preparing to do on a holiday. The various members are seen packing with greater or less success. The luggage is safely stowed with one omission - the luncheon basket is left behind, unnoticed on the pavement. The misadventures of the family are followed throughout their holiday excursion.

results.title: Denver the last dinosaur. 4. Winning!
results.brief_description: Legends of dinosaurs have for centuries enchanted children of all ages, but Denver is the most endearing dinosaur personality ever. In this adventure, Denver and Jeremy enter a wacky game show only to find they’re competing against the team of Morton Fizzback and Professor Funt.

results.title: Denver the last dinosaur. 3. Dinoland
results.brief_description: When Heather gets a job at a dinosaur theme amusement park, Denver roams freely around the park and fits right in with all the dino-costumed employees. But when the roller coaster gets stuck with kids on board, Denver risks exposing his true identity to perform a daring and heroic rescue.

results.title: Denver the last dinosaur. 2. Big top Denver
results.brief_description: Denver and the kids make friends with a circus owner’s son and help him liven up a lack-lustre show with bicycle and skateboard stunts. The updated circus is a tremendous success and Baxter’s Big Top is saved from financial ruin by Denver and his friends.

results.title: Denver the last dinosaur. 1. The Monster of lost lake
results.brief_description: While camping at a mountain lake with his group of ingenious young friends, Denver, the last dinosaur, is mistaken for a horrible lake monster. Hordes of thrill-seeking tourists descend upon the lake, and the boys must use their wits to protect the environment and their friend.

results.title: Dental health - how and why
results.brief_description: A review of what research and experimentation have done to promote better dental health for the American public, including a report on diet and its relation to the growth and decay on teeth, new sodium fluoride applications and the latest techniques of oral hygiene. Shows different types of teeth, the effect of chewing on a tooth, the correct techniques of cleaning teeth.
